meanings.definition: The quality or state of being small or weak in size or strength.
meanings.sent1: The puniness of the toy car made it easy to carry around.
meanings.sent2: The puniness of the kitten made it adorable and endearing.
meanings.sent3: Despite its puniness, the tiny plant managed to survive the harsh winter.
meanings.sent4: The puniness of the flashlight's beam was no match for the darkness of the cave.
meanings.sent5: The puniness of the ant compared to the elephant was truly remarkable.

meanings.sent1: The puniness of the error in the report was quickly overlooked.
meanings.sent2: The puniness of the typo in the email did not affect the overall message.
meanings.sent3: The puniness of the mistake was actually quite amusing in hindsight.
meanings.sent4: The puniness of the issue was blown out of proportion by the gossiping neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The puniness of the decision had a surprisingly large impact on the project outcome.
